130.title: "The Cat's Me-ouse"
130.author: by Bill Newton
130.appears_in: 8 p. in Panhandle Pete and Jennifer, no. 1 (July 1951).
notes: Summary: Panhandle Pete gives Sampson the mouse a mouse-shaped balloon. Sampson inflates the balloon to intimidate the cat, but then the balloon springs a leak. Sampson's brother Herk (who seems to speak a foreign language) then punches the cat right out of the county.

132.heading: Newton, Bill.
132.title: "Panhandle Pete and the Dinosaur"
132.author: Bill Newton
132.appears_in: 12 p. in Panhandle Pete and Jennifer, no. 1 (July 1951).
notes: Summary: Pete and his burro, George Burro, were prospecting in 1878 when they found a friendly dinosaur named Dennis. They start a circus and rake in money. Taint Right, the swindler, tries to buy Dennis, then tries to trick Dennis away by showing him a girl dinosaur (made of cardboard). A lovestruck Dennis breaks loose and heads for the hills looking for the girl dinosaur, and they never see him again. Every time Pete and George see heat lightning, they think it might be Dennis, still searching.

133.heading: Newton, Bill.
133.title: "The Traveling Jail"
133.author: Bill Newton
133.appears_in: 9 p. in Panhandle Pete and Jennifer, no. 2 (Sept. 1951).
notes: Summary: The Coyote Kid trades his sombrero for a file, and gets out of jail only to get stuck in a rain barrel. He then digs out of jail through the floor and runs, only to have a cyclone pick up the jail and drop it on him.
Panhandle Pete and Li'l Wigwam are in the story as humans, and the Kid and Pancho are funny animals.
